chapters.name: Modern Physics
chapters.introduction: Modern Physics covers quantum mechanics, atomic structure, nuclear physics, and semiconductor devices. This chapter is crucial for JEE with high weightage.

chapters.name: Electrostatics & Current Electricity
chapters.introduction: Electrostatics deals with electric charges at rest, electric fields, and potential. Current electricity covers electric current, resistance, and circuits.

chapters.name: Heat & Thermodynamics
chapters.introduction: Thermodynamics studies heat, work, and energy transformations. Covers laws of thermodynamics, heat engines, and kinetic theory of gases.

chapters.name: Oscillations & Waves
chapters.introduction: Simple harmonic motion, wave motion, sound waves, and wave interference. Important for understanding periodic phenomena.

chapters.name: Optics
chapters.introduction: Geometrical and wave optics covering reflection, refraction, lenses, mirrors, interference, diffraction, and polarization.

chapters.name: Mechanics
chapters.introduction: Classical mechanics including kinematics, dynamics, work-energy theorem, momentum, rotational motion, and gravitation.

chapters.name: Organic Chemistry – Some Basic Principles and Techniques
chapters.introduction: Fundamental concepts of organic chemistry including nomenclature, isomerism, electronic effects, and basic reaction mechanisms.

chapters.name: Aldehydes, Ketones and Carboxylic Acids
chapters.introduction: Study of carbonyl compounds, their preparation, properties, and reactions. Important functional groups in organic chemistry.

chapters.name: Haloalkanes and Haloarenes
chapters.introduction: Alkyl and aryl halides, their preparation, properties, and reactions including substitution and elimination mechanisms.

chapters.name: Hydrocarbons
chapters.introduction: Alkanes, alkenes, alkynes, and aromatic hydrocarbons. Their preparation, properties, and characteristic reactions.

chapters.name: Amines
chapters.introduction: Nitrogen-containing organic compounds, their classification, preparation, and reactions. Important in biological systems.

chapters.name: Alcohols, Phenols and Ethers
chapters.introduction: Oxygen-containing organic compounds, their preparation, properties, and reactions. Important functional groups.

chapters.name: Biomolecules
chapters.introduction: Carbohydrates, proteins, lipids, and nucleic acids. Essential molecules of life and their chemical properties.

chapters.name: Coordination Compounds
chapters.introduction: Complex compounds with central metal atoms, ligands, nomenclature, isomerism, and bonding theories.

chapters.name: The d- and f-Block Elements
chapters.introduction: Transition metals and inner transition metals, their properties, compounds, and applications.

chapters.name: Classification of Elements and Periodicity in Properties
chapters.introduction: Periodic table, periodic trends in atomic and physical properties of elements.

chapters.name: The p-Block Elements (Group 15 to 18)
chapters.introduction: Nitrogen, oxygen, halogen, and noble gas families. Their properties, compounds, and reactions.

chapters.name: The p-Block Elements (Other Groups)
chapters.introduction: Boron, carbon, and aluminum families. Their properties, allotropes, and important compounds.

chapters.name: Redox Reactions
chapters.introduction: Oxidation-reduction reactions, balancing redox equations, and electrochemical applications.

chapters.name: Thermodynamics
chapters.introduction: Chemical thermodynamics, enthalpy, entropy, Gibbs free energy, and spontaneity of reactions.

chapters.name: Equilibrium
chapters.introduction: Chemical equilibrium, Le Chatelier's principle, ionic equilibrium, acids, bases, and buffer solutions.

chapters.name: Solutions
chapters.introduction: Types of solutions, concentration terms, colligative properties, and ideal and non-ideal solutions.

chapters.name: Chemical Kinetics
chapters.introduction: Rate of chemical reactions, factors affecting reaction rates, and reaction mechanisms.

chapters.name: Electrochemistry
chapters.introduction: Electrochemical cells, electrode potentials, electrolysis, and corrosion.

chapters.name: Some Basic Concepts of Chemistry
chapters.introduction: Atomic and molecular masses, mole concept, stoichiometry, and percentage composition.

chapters.name: Structure of Atom
chapters.introduction: Atomic models, quantum numbers, electronic configuration, and periodic properties.

chapters.name: Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structure
chapters.introduction: Ionic, covalent, and metallic bonding, molecular geometry, hybridization, and molecular orbital theory.

chapters.name: Principles Related to Practical Chemistry
chapters.introduction: Qualitative and quantitative analysis, detection of elements and functional groups, and volumetric analysis.

chapters.name: Calculus (Limits, Continuity, Differentiation)
chapters.introduction: Fundamental concepts of calculus including limits, continuity, and differentiation with applications.

chapters.name: Integration & Differential Equations
chapters.introduction: Integration techniques, definite integrals, applications of integration, and solving differential equations.

chapters.name: Coordinate Geometry
chapters.introduction: Analytical geometry covering straight lines, circles, parabolas, ellipses, and hyperbolas.

chapters.name: Units and Measurements
chapters.introduction: Fundamental concepts of physical quantities, units, and measurement techniques essential for all physics calculations.

chapters.name: Motion in a Straight Line
chapters.introduction: Kinematics of particles moving in one dimension, including uniform and non-uniform motion.

chapters.name: Motion in a Plane
chapters.introduction: Two-dimensional motion including projectile motion and circular motion.

chapters.name: Laws of Motion
chapters.introduction: Newton's laws of motion and their applications in solving dynamics problems.

chapters.name: Work, Energy and Power
chapters.introduction: Concepts of work, kinetic energy, potential energy, and power in mechanical systems.

chapters.name: System of Particles and Rotational Motion
chapters.introduction: Center of mass, rotational kinematics and dynamics, moment of inertia, and angular momentum.

chapters.name: Gravitation
chapters.introduction: Universal law of gravitation, gravitational field, potential, and planetary motion.

chapters.name: Mechanical Properties of Solids
chapters.introduction: Elastic behavior of solids, stress, strain, and Hooke's law.

chapters.name: Mechanical Properties of Fluids
chapters.introduction: Pressure, Pascal's law, Archimedes' principle, and fluid dynamics.

chapters.name: Thermal Properties of Matter
chapters.introduction: Heat, temperature, thermal expansion, and heat transfer mechanisms.

chapters.name: Thermodynamics
chapters.introduction: Laws of thermodynamics, heat engines, and entropy.

chapters.name: Kinetic Theory
chapters.introduction: Molecular theory of gases, kinetic energy, and gas laws.

chapters.name: Oscillations
chapters.introduction: Simple harmonic motion, damped and forced oscillations.

chapters.name: Waves
chapters.introduction: Wave motion, sound waves, and wave properties.

chapters.name: Electric Charges and Fields
chapters.introduction: Electric charge, Coulomb's law, electric field, and electric flux.

chapters.name: Electrostatic Potential and Capacitance
chapters.introduction: Electric potential, equipotential surfaces, and capacitors.

chapters.name: Current Electricity
chapters.introduction: Electric current, resistance, Ohm's law, and electrical circuits.

chapters.name: Moving Charges and Magnetism
chapters.introduction: Magnetic field due to current, force on moving charges, and Biot-Savart law.

chapters.name: Magnetism and Matter
chapters.introduction: Magnetic properties of materials, magnetic dipole, and Earth's magnetism.

chapters.name: Electromagnetic Induction
chapters.introduction: Faraday's laws, Lenz's law, and electromagnetic induction.

chapters.name: Alternating Current
chapters.introduction: AC circuits, phasors, and electrical power in AC circuits.

chapters.name: Ray Optics and Optical Instruments
chapters.introduction: Reflection, refraction, lenses, and optical instruments.

chapters.name: Wave Optics
chapters.introduction: Interference, diffraction, and polarization of light.

chapters.name: Dual Nature of Radiation and Matter
chapters.introduction: Photoelectric effect, de Broglie wavelength, and wave-particle duality.

chapters.name: Atoms
chapters.introduction: Atomic models, Bohr's theory, and atomic spectra.

chapters.name: Nuclei
chapters.introduction: Nuclear structure, radioactivity, and nuclear reactions.

chapters.name: Semiconductor Electronics
chapters.introduction: Semiconductors, diodes, transistors, and digital electronics.

chapters.introduction: Fundamental concepts including matter, atoms, molecules, stoichiometry, and chemical calculations.

chapters.name: Structure of Atom
chapters.introduction: Atomic models, electronic configuration, quantum numbers, and periodic properties.

chapters.name: Classification of Elements and Periodicity in Properties
chapters.introduction: Periodic table, periodic trends, and properties of elements.

chapters.name: Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structure
chapters.introduction: Ionic and covalent bonding, VSEPR theory, and molecular geometry.

chapters.name: States of Matter
chapters.introduction: Gaseous state, liquid state, and solid state properties.

chapters.introduction: Laws of thermodynamics, enthalpy, entropy, and Gibbs free energy.

chapters.introduction: Alkali and alkaline earth metals, their properties and compounds.

chapters.introduction: Group 13-18 elements, their properties, and important compounds.

chapters.introduction: IUPAC nomenclature, isomerism, electronic effects, and reaction mechanisms.

chapters.introduction: Adsorption, catalysis, and colloids.

chapters.introduction: Metallurgy and extraction of metals.

chapters.introduction: Transition elements, lanthanides, and actinides.

chapters.introduction: Preparation, properties, and reactions of alkyl and aryl halides.

chapters.introduction: Classification, preparation, and properties of polymers.

chapters.introduction: Drugs, medicines, food additives, and cleaning agents.

chapters.introduction: Characteristics of living organisms, taxonomy, and classification systems.

chapters.introduction: Classification of plants, algae, bryophytes, pteridophytes, gymnosperms, and angiosperms.

chapters.introduction: Classification of animals based on body plan, symmetry, and coelom.

chapters.introduction: Tissue systems, tissue types, and internal structure of plant organs.

chapters.introduction: Animal tissues, organ systems, and structural organization.

chapters.introduction: Carbohydrates, proteins, lipids, nucleic acids, and enzymes.
